awd_titl_txt: Study of Ultra High Energy Phenomena Using Cosmic Rays and  the Tevatron Collider (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: This award will provide funds to a group from the                          University of California, Irvine to continue their study of                     ultra high energy (UHE) phenomena using Cosmic Rays and the                     Fermilab Tevatron Collider.  They will continue the search for                  UHE signals from astrophysical point sources and investigate                    the muon content of the showers from these signals and will try                 to determine whether the anomalous muons which have been seen                   in Herculus X-1 bursts, is a universal phenomena among UHE                      sources. These studies are essential for our understanding of                   photon hadron interactions at the center of mass energies in                    the 100 GeV to 1 TeV range.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
